page.title: 10Overstone Pottery
page.content: The pottery is called Overstone.Mrs. Wilson has been a{potter}for thirty-five years and has been at Overstone for nineteen years.She buys her clay from{Stoke on Trent}and a kind dentist has given her some{dental {tools}for using in the pottery.Pottery is made of earth shaped with the aid of water,dried in air and made hard by {fire.}All the{colours}and other things she needs come from the ground.She has a small shop where she sells her pottery.She uses a{machine}to make the clay into a sausage shape.Her{pottery {wheel}runs by its self so she doesn't have to use her feet.Her sister draws the pictures on some of the plates. About forty pieces are made every day.
